snippet: Sheila C. Bair, the former F.D.I.C. chairwoman and author of a new book on the financial crisis, is well positioned to challenge the dogma of bank bailouts.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column contends Sheila C Bair, former Federal Deposit Insurance Corp chairwoman and author of Bull by the Horns, new book on the financial crisis, is well positioned to challenge the dogma of bank bailouts; notes that Bair lists 13 actions she thinks would make banks stronger and regulators more effective, adding that even a few of these would have immediate and extensive benefits.
lead_paragraph: Sheila C. Bair, the former F.D.I.C. chairwoman and author of a new book on the financial crisis, is well positioned to challenge the dogma of bank bailouts.
